page.title: 17COMPUTER POPULARITY
page.content: The most common computer of the 80's, I suppose, is the Spectrum 48K,closely followed by the Electron and the BBC. At school we have 3 BBC model B's, one with disc drive and the others with cassettes.We use them mostly for educational games and programs. At home I have an Electron computer with an analogue to digital valve converter socket which you can plug into light pens, joysticks and paddles.I also borrow an interface from a friend which makes it compatible with a printer. I use my computer for games, copying, and programs like Burglar Alarms or educational games for my younger sister. I now know 5 people who have an Electron and 6 people who have a BBC computer.
